Gettin' nasty
 




Ryane Clowe and Jordan Tootoo pick a fight late in the game. (AP)



    

    

      Nashville avoids a two-game 
      hole against San Jose with a convincing 5-2 victory. Wes 
      Goldstein says the bad blood that already existed betweenthe 
      teams is turning the series into a 
      mean and physical one. NSH-SJ
 Related Links:• Turco sparks to give Stars shutout | Ducks take first two from Wild• Bernier helped off ice | Matchups:  ANA-MIN | VAN-DAL | Bracket


 


 

 





 The Dish: It's all about breaking in stars for postseason


    

      
      In his return, Sam 
      Cassell looked awful -- early. Then he saved L.A. down the 
      stretch. Tony Mejia says how teams re-assimilate players will be 
      key heading into the playoffs.
    

  
• Clips: Crush Trail Blazers | Report | Picks | Blog


 

 





 Judge: Utah's Mr. Versatility could be a big-time steal


    

      
      Corner or safety? Utah's Eric Weddle doesn't want 
      to be the one to decide. He's too busy being a throwback kind of DB, 
      which makes him an intriguing draft consideration.
